aboutFestival: A vibrant gathering of creatives and tech enthusiasts, the festival celebrates collaboration and innovation. Experience a dynamic blend of art and technology through immersive exhibitions, interactive workshops, thought-provoking discussions, and live performances. It’s a space where ideas merge, connections thrive, and the future of creativity is reimagined.
aboutWorkshop: The Cavic Workshop brings together industry experts, visionary panelists, and passionate participants to explore cutting-edge ideas and skills. Through hands-on sessions, masterclasses, and thought-provoking discussions, you'll gain insights into the latest innovations in art, design, and tech. This is your chance to collaborate, learn from the best, and push the boundaries of your creative and technical potential.

pressAppearances.title: Cavic Art And Tech Launches App To Enhance National Cultural Heritage
pressAppearances.excerpt: The Cavic Art and Tech has launched an Application known as Ojiraeyi APP to enhance National Cultural Heritage World Wide.

pressAppearances.title: Art meets tech at CAVIC 2024 festival
pressAppearances.excerpt: It was a vibrant sight of culture, art, and technology at the 2024 creativity and technology festival, which was held in Abuja on Thursday evening and hosted by the Creative Arts and Visual Imagery Centre CAVIC.

pressAppearances.title: NGA, NICO pledges support for CAVIC to synergise Arts, technology, communication
pressAppearances.excerpt: The National Gallery of  Arts (NGA) and National Institute for Cultural Orientation (NICO) has pledged its support for Creative Arts  and Visual Imaginery Centre (CAVIC) to synergise Arts and technology to enhance communication.

pressAppearances.title: Cavic Art And Tech Launches App To Enhance National Cultural Heritage
pressAppearances.excerpt: The National Gallery of Art (NGA) has expressed its readiness to collaborate with the private sector using arts and technology to create employment and boost the economy. The Director General of NGA, Mr Ebeten William Ivara stated this at the Maiden edition of the Creative Arts and Visual Imagery Centre’s (CAVIC) Festival of Art and Technology in Abuja.

pressAppearances.title: Art Technology: National Gallery of Art seeks private sector collaboration
pressAppearances.excerpt: The National Gallery of Art (NGA) has expressed its readiness to collaborate with the private sector using arts and technology to create employment and boost the economy. The Director General of NGA, Mr Ebeten William Ivara stated this at the Maiden edition of the Creative Arts and Visual Imagery Centre’s (CAVIC) Festival of Art and Technology in Abuja.

callToAction.title: Join Us in Shaping the Future
callToAction.description: We're always looking for innovative partners, inspiring speakers, and passionate collaborators. If you're interested in being a part of CAVIC Festival, we'd love to hear from you!
